gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: DELAY.
Explanation: The DELAY module is designed to introduce a delay in the input signal X by 31 clock cycles. It uses a shift register implemented as an array of registers (R) to hold intermediate values of the signal, each slot in the array representing a delay of one clock cycle. The parameter SIZE defines the bit-width of the signal X and Y, whereas RSTVAL sets the reset value. The module outputs the delayed version of X through Y. When the reset is active, all register values, including Y, are set to RSTVAL. During each positive clock edge, the values in the register array R are shifted by one position, effectively moving the input signal X through the registers over time and eventually outputting a delayed version at Y.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports: [reset, clk, scan_in0, scan_in1, scan_in2, scan_in3, scan_in4, scan_enable, test_mode, X]. 
Explanation: 
- reset: A synchronous reset signal that initializes all registers in the module to RSTVAL when high.
- clk: Clock signal used to synchronize the shifting operation in the shift register.
- scan_in0 to scan_in4: Scan inputs (part of a test or scan chain, not implemented in the main functionality shown).
- scan_enable: Enables scan mode for testing (not implemented in the provided functionality).
- test_mode: Indicates the module is in test mode (not implemented in the provided functionality).
- X: Input signal whose values are meant to be delayed through the module.

Output ports: [scan_out0, scan_out1, scan_out2, scan_out3, scan_out4, Y].
Explanation:
- scan_out0 to scan_out4: Scan outputs (part of a test or scan chain, not implemented in the main functionality shown).
- Y: Output signal which carries the value of the input X delayed by 31 clock cycles, achieved through a shift-register mechanism implemented in the module.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals: [R, Y].
Explanation:
- R: This is an array of registers with a length of 31 and each element sized as defined by the parameter SIZE. It acts as a shift register, temporarily storing the delayed versions of the input signal X. Each register in this array represents a clock cycle's delay, and during each positive edge of the clk, the contents of each register are shifted to the next position, moving the input X progressively deeper into the delay line.
- Y: A register that outputs the signal delayed by 31 clock cycles. It directly draws its value from the last register in the shift register array R[30], thus providing the output delayed version of the input X after it has traversed through all positions within the array R.
